column4: I just installed the latest version of Ubuntu, it wont auto mount my sdcard, its not in dmesg and fdisk -l isnt listing it. is there a change I should know about?
when you say "latest" do you mean 12.04 or 12.10?
12.04 that latest stable release
have you upgraded from a older version of ubuntu?
yes, 11 and the earlty 12 release used to auto mount the sd card devices
No, I have done a clean install from an ISO
hmmm no idea you might try googling
Yes, I googled this first.
hmmmm
I have also checked lsusb, dmesg, fdisk -l. None of those programs are detecting the storage device.
have you tried putting the card in another computer?
Yes, I just tried the card in my dell, which is running ubuntu 11. Works fine
can you auto mount another card?
or have you tried manually mounting?
I cant manually mount because it isnt giving it a device name to mount it from
try another card in same computer
I just tried another sd card in this computer, I checked fdisk, lsusb and dmesg. Its still not providing  a device name for this device.
I think this may be a potential issue with this release
then i would say one of two things
ubuntu is messed up or something happened to the reader
since im a hardware person im blaming software :-P
hahah.. I agree. I'm leaning to the fact that its a software issue..
i don't have a install of 12.04 to test
I've solved my problem.. It was a hardware failure.. the UBS port that the sd card reader was plugged into went dead.. I moved it to a new usb port and Wala!
